documentContentReferences.name: Screening Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the 'PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE' to Section 8, which details procedures specific to screening sites in the US.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 2.3.1.1 to Section 10.5 for potential risks and mitigation measures due to the COVID-19 vaccine.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Mitigation Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 3 to Section 6.6 for dose modification or discontinuation as a mitigation strategy for various potential risks.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Features Table Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 4.1 to Table 4, which describes the adaptive design features of the study.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 4 to Table 7, which outlines the criteria for dose modification.

documentContentReferences.name: Blood Donation Restriction Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 5 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 5.2 regarding the exclusion criterion for blood donation prior to screening.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraception Guidance Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 5 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 10.4 for details on appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to the Schedule of Activities for data to be collected at the time of study intervention discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to Section 8.2.6, indicating pregnancy as a reason for discontinuation from study intervention.

documentContentReferences.name: QTc Withdrawal Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: DISCONTINUATION OF STUDY INTERVENTION AND PARTICIPANT DISCONTINUATION/WITHDRAWAL
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.3 to Section 7 for QTc withdrawal criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Clinical Lab Tests Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.2.4 to Section 10.2 for the list of clinical laboratory tests to be performed.

documentContentReferences.name: AE/SAE Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Adverse Events: Definitions and Procedures for Recording, Evaluating, Follow-up, and Reporting
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3 to Section 10.3 for procedures on recording, evaluating, following up, and reporting AEs and SAEs.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.3 to Section 7.3 for the definition of 'lost to follow-up'.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetic Testing Non-use Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.6 to Section 8.7, confirming that biobanked samples will not be used for genetic testing.

documentContentReferences.name: Sample Collection Schedule Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Sections 8.5 and 8.6 to the SoA (Table 1) for the schedule of PK and PD sample collections.

documentContentReferences.name: Molybdenum Measurement Details
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.5 to Section 8.1.1 for details on molybdenum measurement in food, drinks, urine, and feces.

documentContentReferences.name: Analysis Populations Definition
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 9.3 to Table 8, which defines the population sets for analyses.

commentAnnotations.text: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE
Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: A cannula may be placed to minimize needle sticks; however, a catheter may not be left in place for longer than 72 hours and should be flushed a minimum of every 8 hours.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Outpatient Period (Day 9 to Day 23) may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval. Limit: Not >14 days
Dose range limit 15 mg every other day to 30 mg/day
Rescreened participants are not required to reconsent as long as they have signed the latest version of the ICF.

Note: total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Clarify study procedures in the US to facilitate recruitment and lessen inconvenience for participants.
